column1: This gives the courts a useful power to separate the wheat from the chaff among the pending cases.

column1: The process is a bit like winnowing, the old method of using the wind to separate wheat from chaff, except that in the case of pyroclastic material there is no simple division into light material ( husks ) and heavy ( grain ) but a continuous gradation in sizes ( and therefore weight ) of particles from fine to coarse.
column3: separate the wheat from the chaff
